summary.long: 1 Thessalonians is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text:
Paul, Silvanus, and Timothy,
To the church of the Thessalonians in God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ:
Grace to you and peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We always give thanks to God for all of you and mention you in our prayers, constantly
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: remembering before our God and Father your work of faith and labor of love and steadfastness of hope in our Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we know, brothers and sisters beloved by God, that he has chosen you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because our message of the gospel came to you not in word only but also in power and in the Holy Spirit and with full conviction; just as you know what kind of persons we proved to be among you for your sake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you became imitators of us and of the Lord, for in spite of persecution you received the word with joy from the Holy Spirit,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that you became an example to all the believers in Macedonia and in Achaia.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the word of the Lord has sounded forth from you not only in Macedonia and Achaia but in every place your faith in God has become known, so that we have no need to speak about it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they report about us what kind of welcome we had among you and how you turned to God from idols to serve a living and true God
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to wait for his Son from heaven, whom he raised from the dead—Jesus, who rescues us from the coming wrath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You yourselves know, brothers and sisters, that our coming to you was not in vain,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but though we had already suffered and been shamefully mistreated at Philippi, as you know, we had courage in our God to declare to you the gospel of God in spite of great opposition.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For our appeal does not spring from deceit or impure motives or trickery,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but, just as we have been approved by God to be entrusted with the message of the gospel, even so we speak, not to please mortals but to please God, who tests our hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As you know and as God is our witness, we never came with words of flattery or with a pretext for greed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: nor did we seek praise from mortals, whether from you or from others,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: though we might have made demands as apostles of Christ. But we were gentle among you, like a nurse tenderly caring for her own children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So deeply do we care for you that we are determined to share with you not only the gospel of God but also our own selves, because you have become very dear to us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You remember our labor and toil, brothers and sisters; we worked night and day so that we might not burden any of you while we proclaimed to you the gospel of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are witnesses, and God also, how pure, upright, and blameless our conduct was toward you believers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As you know, we dealt with each one of you like a father with his children,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: urging and encouraging you and pleading that you lead a life worthy of God, who calls you into his own kingdom and glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We also constantly give thanks to God for this, that when you received the word of God that you heard from us you accepted it not as a human word but as what it really is, God’s word, which is also at work in you believers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you, brothers and sisters, became imitators of the churches of God in Christ Jesus that are in Judea, for you suffered the same things from your own compatriots as they did from the Jews
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who killed both the Lord Jesus and the prophets and drove us out; they displease God and oppose everyone
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: by hindering us from speaking to the gentiles so that they may be saved. Thus they have constantly been filling up the measure of their sins, but wrath has overtaken them at last.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for us, brothers and sisters, when for a short time we were made orphans by being separated from you—in person, not in heart—we longed with great eagerness to see you face to face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we wanted to come to you—certainly I, Paul, wanted to again and again—but Satan blocked our way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For what is our hope or joy or crown of boasting before our Lord Jesus at his coming? Is it not you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yes, you are our glory and joy!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore when we could bear it no longer, we decided to be left alone in Athens
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and sent Timothy, our brother and God’s coworker in the gospel of Christ, to strengthen and encourage you for the sake of your faith,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that no one would be shaken by these persecutions. Indeed, you yourselves know that this is what we are destined for.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In fact, when we were with you, we told you beforehand that we were to suffer persecution; so it turned out, as you know.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this reason, when I could bear it no longer, I sent to find out about your faith; I was afraid that somehow the tempter had tempted you and that our labor had been in vain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Timothy has just now come to us from you and has brought us the good news of your faith and love. He has told us also that you always remember us kindly and long to see us, just as we long to see you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this reason, brothers and sisters, during all our distress and persecution we have been encouraged about you through your faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we now live, if you continue to stand firm in the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How can we thank God enough for you in return for all the joy that we feel before our God because of you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Night and day we pray most earnestly that we may see you face to face and restore whatever is lacking in your faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now may our God and Father himself and our Lord Jesus direct our way to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And may the Lord make you increase and abound in love for one another and for all, just as we abound in love for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And may he so strengthen your hearts in holiness that you may be blameless before our God and Father at the coming of our Lord Jesus with all his saints.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Finally, brothers and sisters, we ask and urge you in the Lord Jesus that, as you learned from us how you ought to live and to please God (as, in fact, you are doing), you should do so more and more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you know what instructions we gave you through the Lord Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this is the will of God, your sanctification: that you abstain from sexual immorality;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that each one of you know how to control your own body in holiness and honor,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: not with lustful passion, like the gentiles who do not know God;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that no one wrong or exploit a brother or sister in this matter, because the Lord is an avenger in all these things, just as we have already told you beforehand and solemnly warned you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For God did not call us to impurity but in holiness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore whoever rejects this rejects not human authority but God, who also gives his Holy Spirit to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now concerning love of the brothers and sisters, you do not need to have anyone write to you, for you yourselves have been taught by God to love one another,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and indeed you do love all the brothers and sisters throughout Macedonia. But we urge you, brothers and sisters, to do so more and more,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to aspire to live quietly, to mind your own affairs, and to work with your hands, as we directed you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that you may behave properly toward outsiders and be dependent on no one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we do not want you to be uninformed, brothers and sisters, about those who have died, so that you may not grieve as others do who have no hope.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For since we believe that Jesus died and rose again, even so, through Jesus, God will bring with him those who have died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this we declare to you by the word of the Lord, that we who are alive, who are left until the coming of the Lord, will by no means precede those who have died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord himself, with a cry of command, with the archangel’s call and with the sound of God’s trumpet, will descend from heaven, and the dead in Christ will rise first.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then we who are alive, who are left, will be caught up in the clouds together with them to meet the Lord in the air, and so we will be with the Lord forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore encourage one another with these words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now concerning the times and the seasons, brothers and sisters, you do not need to have anything written to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you yourselves know very well that the day of the Lord will come like a thief in the night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they say, “There is peace and security,” then sudden destruction will come upon them, as labor pains come upon a pregnant woman, and there will be no escape!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you, brothers and sisters, are not in darkness, for that day to surprise you like a thief;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for you are all children of light and children of the day; we are not of the night or of darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So, then, let us not fall asleep as others do, but let us keep awake and be sober,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for those who sleep sleep at night, and those who are drunk get drunk at night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But since we belong to the day, let us be sober and put on the breastplate of faith and love and for a helmet the hope of salvation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For God has destined us not for wrath but for obtaining salvation through our Lord Jesus Christ,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who died for us, so that whether we are awake or asleep we may live with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore encourage one another and build up each other, as indeed you are doing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we appeal to you, brothers and sisters, to respect those who labor among you and have charge of you in the Lord and admonish you;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: esteem them very highly in love because of their work. Be at peace among yourselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And we urge you, brothers and sisters, to admonish the idlers, encourage the fainthearted, help the weak, be patient with all of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See that none of you repays evil for evil, but always seek to do good to one another and to all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Rejoice always,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: pray without ceasing,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: give thanks in all circumstances, for this is the will of God in Christ Jesus for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not quench the Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not despise prophecies,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but test everything; hold fast to what is good;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: abstain from every form of evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: May the God of peace himself sanctify you entirely, and may your spirit and soul and body be kept sound and blameless at the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who calls you is faithful, and he will do this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Brothers and sisters, pray for us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Greet all the brothers and sisters with a holy kiss.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I solemnly command you by the Lord that this letter be read to all the brothers and sisters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator
